panels.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.
panels.title: average IO wait time

panels.description: The number of outstanding requests at the instant the sample was taken. Incremented as requests are given to appropriate struct request_queue and decremented as they finish.
panels.title: max instantaneous queue size

panels.description: The average queue length of the requests that were issued to the device
panels.title: weighted io wait time (approximation for average queue size)

targets.expr: rate(node_pressure_cpu_waiting_seconds_total{instance="$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
rate(node_pressure_memory_waiting_seconds_total{instance="$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
rate(node_pressure_memory_stalled_seconds_total{instance="$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
rate(node_pressure_io_waiting_seconds_total{instance="$instance"}[$__rate_interval])
rate(node_pressure_io_stalled_seconds_total{instance="$instance"}[$__rate_interval])

options.content:
If your node has a lot of ZFS `zd*` devices
that clutter the output,
you can use "Device type" selector to remove them.

Statistics for whole devices, without `pX` suffix,
are a sum of statistics for all partitions.

panels.description: The average time for requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

targets.expr:
rate(node_disk_read_time_seconds_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval])
/
(rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-6)
* on(instance, device) group_left(model, serial)
node_disk_info{instance="$instance", device=~"$device", serial!=""}

rate(node_disk_read_time_seconds_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval])
/
(rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-6)
* on(instance, device) group_left(model, serial)
node_disk_info{instance="$instance", device=~"$device", serial=""}

panels.title: average read wait time

panels.description: The average time for requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them.

targets.expr:
rate(node_disk_write_time_seconds_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval])
/
(rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-6)
* on(instance, device) group_left(model, serial)
node_disk_info{instance="$instance", device=~"$device", serial!=""}

rate(node_disk_write_time_seconds_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval])
/
(rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{instance="$instance", device=~"$device"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-6)
* on(instance, device) group_left(model, serial)
node_disk_info{instance="$instance", device=~"$device", serial=""}

panels.title: average write wait time

panels.description: The number of read and write requests merged per second that were queued to the device
panels.title: IOps read merged

panels.description: The number of read and write requests merged per second that were queued to the device
panels.title: IOps write merged

panels.description: Percentage of elapsed time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100% for devices serving requests serially.  But for devices  serving requests in parallel, such as RAID arrays and modern SSDs, this number does not reflect their performance limits.
panels.title: average discard wait time

list.label: Device type
list.name: device_type
list.query: scsi : sd[a-z]+, scsi partition : sd[a-z]+[0-9]+, nvme : nvme[0-9]+n[0-9]+, nvme partition : nvme[0-9]+n[0-9]+p[0-9]+, mmc : mmcblk[0-9]+, zfs volume : zd.*
